I'm 20 and childless but close enough

This. Everyone acts like kids should be able to do whatever they want, explore whatever they want, become whoever they want, etc., but that mindset doesn't take into account the differences between children and adults. Children do not have fully developed brains, are highly impressionable, and are not capable of making fully rational decisions. We can't just let them run off and do whatever they want because it will hurt them in the long run.
Sexualized lyrics aren't an interest. They don't have enough substance to be considered an interest.
You don't seem to understand parenting very well.

It's not just that tribal, it's that most of the fun moments this season came from either Tony, JT, or Sandra, and all three of those people are gone now. And Brad, Troyzan, Zeke, Sierra, and Andrea all made the merge.

Debbie: Jeff, I'd like to play my extra vote.
[CUT to unprecedented TC confessional] Debbie: I knew I had to play my second vote tonight because I actually serve as a ballot counter during election season, so I have a lot of experience weighing when votes are going a certain way. And tonight, my frontal lobe was just buzzing that the votes weren't going my way.
Jeff: Alright, Debbie will now vote again.
Debbie writes down Brad on the parchment. Voting Confessional: you CRUSHED MY HEART and now I'm crushing yours.
Debbie returns to her seat next to Brad, and as she does, says: Did you see that Brad? I voted more than you!

I had a strong feeling he would go home early because when the preview for the season aired at the MvGX reunion show he tweeted something like "Sandra's already got a winner's edit". In the comments for that post here people said that that meant either there was no way that Sandra was going to win or that he went home early and didn't know whether she went, so I guessed it would be the latter. Ironically both turned out to be true.

Even throughout the finale. Watching the jury cheering so hard for her to win the firemaking competition, Michele saying that they just lost to Tai, Neal trashing Michele, it all seemed to be pointing towards a landslide Aubry win. Unfortunately because of the Michele-truthers, I knew that there was no actual shot of her winning, so it was really weird to watch.

Right well until you prove to me that these vague "some people" are a significant amount that actually exist, what you're saying is essentially irrelevant.
And besides, even if people did root for Rob and Parvati but criticized Dawn, the solution wouldn't be also rooting for Dawn, it would be to stop rooting for Rob and Parvati. So you can't use people rooting for those two as an excuse for what Dawn did.

I'm kind of frustrated too because we know literally nothing about Christa, so this twist was ultimately meaningless. I don't know whether it's because the anime is rushed or if that's how it was in the manga, but I would've liked to have been introduced to her earlier because even in that conversation she had with Ymir I had no idea what they were talking about so that scene is lost on me.
Is it just me or was the animation really subpar this episode? Half of the time the characters in the background weren't even moving. I mean, did it really take a four year wait for this?
I can't believe that Debbie has the most confessionals of any remaining player. What universe did we slip into?

I think Debbie and Sarah's reactions were genuine, Tai was really supportive of both sides, Ozzy felt like a douche to me because he stuck in his "you should be ashamed" after Varner had already apologized a ton and everyone else was already done yelling at him for quite a while, and Andrea's reaction felt incredibly fake to me. She really felt like she was playing it up for the cameras.
People are upset about it because it always screws someone over who doesn't have a fair chance to recover from it. Jerri, Sandra, Woo, etc.
that's for sure
I guess you could see she was...shirked.

It isn't. I see no one applauding Rob M for what he did, and with Parvati, Parvati didn't really have a close relationship with Ozzy, it was Amanda who did, and she didn't betray him.
Dawn is held to a high standard because her bond with Brenda went outside the game. Brenda was there to comfort her as a person, not as a player, and made a real friendship with Dawn, or at least she thought. So when Dawn betrayed her, I can completely understand her questioning how important the personal drama really was, and therefore testing it in her FTC speech.
I would agree that her demeanor has been slightly spoilery, but it's not like she's outright spoiled anything.
I can't wait to see what she means by "we did it!" lol.
Eh it really underplays Dawn's betrayal of Brenda. It could be a lot more objective.
You can discuss whatever you want but don't be surprised to be called out for it when you inject it into a completely unrelated thread.

Oh I know everyone loved them and that just annoys me even more. To me, I enjoyed this show in spite of it being Damon Lindelof. I enjoyed how grounded and realistic it was for the first season and a half, despite the fantastical premise. That was an awesome contrast in my eyes. But then Damon Lindelof couldn't resist doing the same thing he did Lost and had to add in some lazy loss of reality bullshit like he always did and it was frustrating to me... Because that's not what this show was about.

It makes me sad because, as someone who wants to be on the show, I want to believe it's possible to be some super fan who applied for years before getting cast, but then if you actually look at the fans who have been cast recently, they were successful from like their first applications.
... That's still not relevant to the conversation at all?

I mean Scot's a dick and I'm not surprised to see this from him...But he's not completely wrong.
Wow really? I barely even knew season 3 was in production. I really hope it doesn't go too far off the deep end like the latter half of season 2.

Super Mario Galaxy. I was 11 when it came out and a few years afterwards I very vividly remember a winter day when it was just me and my mom and I was playing this game while she made dinner and then we had dinner together. It sounds so simple but for some reason it's really stuck in my head as being special.

I always wanted to play this game as a kid, something about Bowser's castle floating off with peach's to space was so magical to me, but no one in my family liked it so I didn't get to play it until I was like a teen. Regardless I have a lot of nostalgia for it.
Natalie would've been on Mana though because Sierra was her replacement.

I know what bullying is I've experienced it my whole life thanks. With bullying you can choose to separate yourself from the bullies or grow thicker skin. Does it still suck? Of course I'm not saying either situation is a good one. But with being blacklisted you have no control. You can't change your fate, and people still bully you.
I'd rather be bullied than blacklisted from any sort of public position ever again.
I'm only saying it because I have seen people say "why would you feel bad for Varner" or "Zeke is the one who needs love more right now".

WRITING.TITLE: Saw this and it reminded me how much I wish Natalie had been on this season

WRITING.TEXT: THIS is why this is harder for Varner than Zeke.
Some of her reactions felt really fake to me idk why p

It really just annoyed me because it's so OTT winners edit and I'll die if Brad wins. Also I didn't like how it was a really interesting character moment for all of them but then they only included it for strategic reasons.

I don't believe in something being unforgivable and I don't pretend like I haven't made mistakes or said things I've regretted in my life. It's easy to say that Varner has issues because then you distance yourself from an ugly behavior. But no one is perfect and it's called being human.

I think that he does need to be praised for being so apologetic about it because if we crucify the people who do something wrong but feel remorse, why would anyone ever bother feeling remorse? It's important to forgive Jeff right now because if we don't forgive in situations like this no one will ever be open to admitting they are wrong and learning from their mistakes and that's only going to create more polarization in the already highly contentious social climate of our society.
It's called haggling. She has to work her way up to an A.
